title: Profiles In Soil Health: "Enhancing Soil Systems Utilizing Grazing Practices" With Steve Reimer

tasks.task: Discuss the family's legacy in farming and evolving grazing practices.
subtasks: Talk about family history and the farm's heritage.
Mention the grandfather's breed of cattle (Hereford) and their significance.
Describe past grazing methods (grazing in pastures during specific seasons).
Explain current grazing practices (using smaller trap areas and multiple grass types).
Discuss flexibility in grazing due to unpredictable weather.
Highlight the importance of cover crops and byproducts in the farming system.
Mention how cover cropping and grazing benefit soil health and microbial activity.

tasks.task: Explain the holistic approach to farming, emphasizing resilience and sustainability.
subtasks: Describe the rotation of cereal grains (corn, wheat, beans) and their role in the system.
Discuss the integration of grazing with grain production and cover crops.
Explain the benefits of enhancing the system through grazing and cover crops.
Highlight the importance of water holding capacity and soil quality.
Emphasize the goal of maintaining soil quality and profitability.
